title: Confirmed Shyvana changes incoming!
body:
http://i.imgur.com/SiOmwdf.png

**Vibrates with anticipation**

And she deserves it. She was completely missed in the Juggernaut update.

> [{quoted}](name=Meddler,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Bj78lEp4,comment-id=0002000100000001,timestamp=2016-10-18T23:42:53.270+0000)
>
> Lack of a gap closer on a basic ability, more sustained damage pattern than most divers, CC light relative to Diver norms.

So she virtually has no reliable CC. Her ult is hard to land and bugged and only applies the CC half the time when it does land giving the player like a 75% to miss her CC
Is (current) Urgot a juggernaut by that logic?
I don't think so. His durability is a bit low, his effective range is a bit high, and he don't really like being in the thick of things. Doesn't feel like a Juggernaut, to me.

Sorry about this... BUT WHAT ABOUT XIN ZHAO, MEDDLER?!

Shyvana has ranged poke, Xin Zhao has nothing. Shyvana is so much tankier than Xin Zhao. Xin has no real CC either, and his damage can't really even match most divers even with Fervor not yet nerfed. He can't even tank that much more damage compared to an ADC, and his ult stun and damage is completely unreliable and nearly non-existent.

Why is Shyvana getting some love but Xin Zhao gets nerfed over and over again since the devastating 6.4 AS nerf??

What, what what ?!

Xin has a gap closer on a basic ability, a bump (= hard CC) on a basic ability, and with equal amounts of Gold, his damage is totally on-par with Shyv's damage. His only drawback compare to Shyv is that he is indeed far less tanky. (And even that, if he is ahead, his on-hit healing helps him a lot.)
I'm not Riot, but I would assume it's because her ult is mostly a gapcloser and she lacks any CC in her kit to follow up on a kit.

If I may ask, why is it that Shyvana seems to cause so many problems for you guys?

Everytime in the past that Shyvana has become a popular choice in solo queue, or been viable in pro play, red posts have started talking about her kit being unhealthy and needing a minor rework. Then once she stops being flavour of the month, all that talk of changing her dies down, usually with no changes being done one way or another. On more than one occasion, crazy changes for her have appeared on the PBE, only to disappear pretty quickly. During the juggernaut update, Shyvana was apparently a major contender who just narrowly missed out, and (alongside Olaf) was supposed to get work later, only for that work to be called off when it was decided that Shyvana was more of a diver than a juggernaut... only to now be considered more of a juggernaut than a diver again.

I realize Shyvana's not the only champion to have issues like this come up, but I still can't help but wonder why it seems to be so difficult to figure out what to do with her. It genuinely feels like nobody can decide if she actually has problems or if she's totally fine. Just what is it about her kit that seems to cause so much trouble?

She's a melee sustained auto-attacker.

Riot's had some major trouble since Beta with that archetype. They tend to get absolutely destroyed in lane since they can't really poke or last-hit from range, eat tons of poke themselves, and have a hard time trading since they have lower burst and need to spend a while in melee range to deal decent damage.

This results in goofy things just to make them viable like Tryndamere's ult, Yi's Q and W, and Irelia's entire kit.

Shyvana seems to get a little bit of tankiness, but has no sustain to heal off the poke she takes and no CC to keep people in range long enough to win trades. So she either sucks in lane, or her damage numbers are high enough that she dominates.
My opinion is that it makes shit all sense to consider a champion with one of the longest range dashes in the game as a Juggernaut. The only logical thing to class her as is a Diver.

The thing about divers is that they tend to be almost assassin-like in their playstyle. Since they're all about diving into the enemy team and killing a priority target, they tend to have a decent amount of CC and burst damage to lock the target down and kill them quickly before the enemy team collapses on top of the diver and kills them.

Shyvana has neither of those things. Her damage is all sustained and she has no CC whatsoever other than a very slight knockback that often does more to help a target escape than to lock them down. Like a juggernaut, she's also extraordinarily vulnerable to kiting. Even once she dashes onto the target, there isn't much she can do to actually stay there, and she only gets the one dash since its her ultimate, while many divers are more mobile than that especially in a prolonged engagement.

>The thing about divers is that they tend to be almost assassin-like in their playstyle. 

J4 and Hec are both divers and they both have a similar bruiser playstyle to Shyvana.

>they tend to have a decent amount of CC and burst damage to lock the target down and kill them quickly before the enemy team collapses on top of the diver and kills them.

There are plenty of divers who have entirely sustained damage, just going to copy a list of them here

>_Vi_
**Xin Zhao
Nocturne**
Pantheon
_Jarvan
Wukong_
**Warwick**
Renekton
_Elise_
**Hecarim**
_Lee Sin_
**Irelia
Aatrox
Evelynn**
_Diana_

All of the bolded ones are mostly sustained damage. The Italics are a mix of sustained and burst. Divers are overwhelmingly a sustained damage class.

So what it comes down to is CC vs Mobility. CC is peripheral to the diver class. There are divers with very low levels of CC. Evelynn has a slow, one slow. Diana only has her pull. Noct only has his fear. WW only has his long CD ult. Shyv's knockback fits fine here, it's about the same as Diana's pull or Eve's slow.

On the other hand Juggernauts do not have mobility at all. The next longest ranged dash on a Juggernaut is Illaoi. Think about that. Which group does she actually fit better into with that in mind?

> [{quoted}](name=LankPants,realm=OCE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Bj78lEp4,comment-id=00020001000200000000,timestamp=2016-10-19T01:01:09.809+0000)
>
> J4 and Hec are both divers and they both have a similar bruiser playstyle to Shyvana.
> 
> There are plenty of divers who have entirely sustained damage, just going to copy a list of them here
> **Xin Zhao
> Nocturne**
> Pantheon
> _Jarvan
> Wukong_
> **Warwick**
> Renekton
> _Elise_
> **Hecarim**
> _Lee Sin_
> **Irelia
> Aatrox
> Evelynn**
> _Diana_
> 
> All of the bolded ones are mostly sustained damage. The Italics are a mix of sustained and burst. Divers are overwhelmingly a sustained damage class.

Evelynn and Xin Zhao should both be in italics, as both of them are fully capable of bursting somebody the fuck down, and Hecarim and Warwick are both closer to hybrids than pure divers. Furthermore, one of the primary differences between assassins and divers is that once the target is down, the assassin is squishy and more mobile and typically needs to disengage from the fight, while a diver is tankier but lacks tools to get out, forcing them to stand and fight. That's usually where the sustained damage comes in, after the target they were diving onto is dead. That's why the burst is typically of a higher priority than the sustained damage, and it's why the majority of them, even on that list, have solid burst that Shyv doesn't have.

But you're right, there are a few of them who are also pretty heavy on sustain, so let's look at CC.
 
> So what it comes down to is CC vs Mobility. CC is peripheral to the diver class. There are divers with very low levels of CC. Evelynn has a slow, one slow. Diana only has her pull. Noct only has his fear. WW only has his long CD ult. Shyv's knockback fits fine here, it's about the same as Diana's pull or Eve's slow.

It absolutely does not fit fine. ALL of those divers, each and every one of them, has more CC than Shyvana does except for Evelynn, and Evelynn is supposed to be an assassin but is currently classified as a diver because her kit is fucked up and she's in desperate need of a VGU. Even Diana's E is more CC than Shyvana's ult since the pull has more control over it than Shyv's tiny knockback while also applying a decent slow, having a lower CD, and combines with Diana's dash ALSO having a lower CD letting her dive both more consistently and more frequently. Nocturne's fear is a solid 2.25 seconds at max rank which is good sized CC duration, and WW's ult is pretty much instant death on somebody who's out of position. They may not have a LOT of CC, but a diver's CC is undeniably effective; because it's not peripheral, it's a requirement for them to get the job done.

> On the other hand Juggernauts do not have mobility at all. The next longest ranged dash on a Juggernaut is Illaoi. Think about that. Which group does she actually fit better into with that in mind?

Still Juggernauts, because that dash is making up for the fact that, even amongst Juggernauts, a class which is known for having really weak CC, Shyvana still gets the shitty end of the stick. Darius has his grab, Garen can slow/silence, Trundle has pillars, Olaf (another juggernaut who's in a kind of hybrid diver/juggernaut scenario with Shyv) can chain slows with his axes, Udyr stuns, Mundo chain slows with cleavers, Nasus has goddamned Wither, and Skarner...

Skarner is in fact the best demonstration of the following fact: Even amongst champions sharing a class, there are differences that make them better or worse at specific things, that give them a niche that makes them unique. Skarner's an example of a juggernaut who has way more CC than he should for his class. That's his niche. That's the category Shyvana's dash falls into, that's her niche. She is better than other juggernauts at actually getting to her target because of it, but at the cost of being one of the ones who has the hardest time sticking to them once she gets there because only Mordekaiser has less CC than she does.

The difference that makes Shyvana a juggernaut with a dash and not a diver with no CC, is that a diver with no CC can't do its job right and is fundamentally flawed from a design standpoint.

>That's why the burst is typically of a higher priority than the sustained damage, and it's why the majority of them, even on that list, have solid burst that Shyv doesn't have.

If you know how to AA rest properly with Shyv she does have solid burst. R+E+AA+Hydra reset+Q reset does a fuck ton of damage in about 1 second. It's actually more than a champ like WW or Aatrox can put out.

>Even Diana's E is more CC than Shyvana's ult since the pull has more control over it than Shyv's tiny knockback while also applying a decent slow, having a lower CD, and combines with Diana's dash ALSO having a lower CD letting her dive both more consistently and more frequently.

It's also far less powerful than Shyv's ult as a CC. Shyv's ult (when it works) is a far more impactful spell since the knockback is far longer and the AOE is big enough to catch most if not all of the enemy team. All Riot needs to do is fix the ult so it works correctly and Shyv would be right in line with the low CC end of the divers.

If Riot wanted to maintain Shyvana's playstlye with buffs the best way to do it IMO would be to fix her ult's knockback, make her immune to CC while ulting and give her a Vayne stlye stun against walls. This would make Shyvana scarier in invades, better at running away in the jungle and make her ult not clunky as hell. It just seems like the best way to deal with her to me and it would push her more towards the diver class.

>Skarner is in fact the best demonstration of the following fact: Even amongst champions sharing a class, there are differences that make them better or worse at specific things, that give them a niche that makes them unique. Skarner's an example of a juggernaut who has way more CC than he should for his class. That's his niche. That's the category Shyvana's dash falls into, that's her niche. She is better than other juggernauts at actually getting to her target because of it, but at the cost of being one of the ones who has the hardest time sticking to them once she gets there because only Mordekaiser has less CC than she does.

[Skarner is listed as a Vanguard.](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/developer-corner/3A5uuBw7-champion-subclass-list) So this really isn't relevant, in fact it's detrimental to what you're trying to prove.

>The difference that makes Shyvana a juggernaut with a dash and not a diver with no CC, is that a diver with no CC can't do its job right and is fundamentally flawed from a design standpoint.

Now you're arguing on semantics, because Shyvana is a diver without CC regardless of what you classify her as. Even if you want to call her a Juggernaut me defining her as a diver with no CC is still an apt description. She's a champion who, if given CC would fit perfectly into the diver class, and therefore is a diver without CC.

> [{quoted}](name=LankPants,realm=OCE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Bj78lEp4,comment-id=0002000100020000000000000000,timestamp=2016-10-19T02:23:06.409+0000)
> 
> [Skarner is listed as a Vanguard.](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/developer-corner/3A5uuBw7-champion-subclass-list) So this really isn't relevant, in fact it's detrimental to what you're trying to prove.

Skarner was updated as part of the juggernaut update, so I labelled him as such. But if you would prefer we use that list since it's more up to date, sure, we can do that.

> **Juggernauts**
> 
> * Nasus
> * Darius
> * Mordekaiser
> * Illaoi
> * Trundle
> * Olaf
> * Garen 
>* ** Shyvana**
> * Udyr
> * Dr. Mundo
> * Volibear
> * Yorick

I'm arguing against that specific placement, so that list isn't really usable as an ultimate debunking tool against my argument.

If you want to argue why Skarner is a Juggernaut go ahead, there's plenty of actual reason why he's a Vanguard and not a Juggernaut. He has 2 hard CC abilities, one of which is potentially AOE. Sure he has high damage but it's not in a Juggernaut pattern, it's more in a high damage Vanguard pattern similar to Sej or Amumu, lots of damage with very low focus. If you want me to continue arguing this I can, Skarner fits very well into the Vanguard class or a Vanguard/Diver Hybrid class which could potentially exist containing {{champion:32}} {{champion:36}} {{champion:120}} {{champion:33}} {{champion:421}} {{champion:58}} {{champion:113}} {{champion:102}} {{champion:72}} and {{champion:154}} , since these champs dispersed across 3 classes are all surprisingly similar.

On the other hand Shyvana's placement is far more arguable. She has something that's clearly not at all present on any other Juggernaut, her dash is about 5x longer than the next longest on a Juggernaut and there are only two others in the class who even have dashes (Illaoi and Udyr) and they're both under 200 range. Shyvana's ult range is 1000.

If you would argue that specific placement in the list, than any other placement on the list becomes just as malleable.

You could argue that Skarner's damage output is too high for a Vanguard. Ashe has long-range initiation, which no other marksman has, would you argue that she's not a marksman because of it? Ekko has way more utility than any assassin (which he's being included in as part of the assassin update), but also way more than any Skirmisher (which he's listed on that list as). Lissandra and Ahri both have dashes/mobility, which no other burst mage has. You could make the argument that maybe Ahri should be an assassin since her mobility is so high and that's how she was originally presented, but could you honestly make the same argument for Lissandra? I mean, she has mobility so clearly she can't be a burst mage since they're not supposed to have that.

Every class has a character or two that pushes the boundaries of what that class is actually supposed to do, because otherwise it's more difficult to keep the characters in that class from being homogenous. Just because a champion has an ability that falls outside of the typical skillset of that class, doesn't mean that's not where they belong.

Shyvana has a skill that would be typically associated with being a diver. However, even in that skill, she lacks the consistency and effectiveness of an actual diver. Meanwhile she has the same damage profile and vulnerabilities as a juggernaut. Riot has classified her as a juggernaut with some diver attributes, and I would agree with them. To make Shyvana a diver who's actually good at the job would require more substantial changes to her kit.

>You could argue that Skarner's damage output is too high for a Vanguard.

Low damage isn't part of the Vanguard class. This is a class that contains Amumu, Sejuani and Zac, there's plenty of high damage Vanguards.

>Ekko has way more utility than any assassin (which he's being included in as part of the assassin update), but also way more than any Skirmisher (which he's listed on that list as).

Current Ekko's best fit is either Diver or Vanguard, probably Diver. He's getting changed in the preseason though and Riot's explicitly stated that the want to align him more with Skirmishers.
 
>Lissandra and Ahri both have dashes/mobility, which no other burst mage has. 

Where else do you put them? I'd make an argument that Ahri could be a Skirmisher and Liss could be a Disrupter but neither of these placements are really better than Burst Mage for either.

>Shyvana has a skill that would be typically associated with being a diver. However, even in that skill, she lacks the consistency and effectiveness of an actual diver. Meanwhile she has the same damage profile and vulnerabilities as a juggernaut. 

All of Shyvana's skills align with Divers. There are divers with durability steroids. There are divers with on-hit AA resets. There are divers with MS steroids and AOE damage spells. Her E is the most generic thing ever. There are Divers with long ranged dashes, although few as long as Shyvana. Why wouldn't you put Shyvana in the Diver class, she doesn't seem to break any rules and seems to fit very well overall.

>Riot has classified her as a juggernaut with some diver attributes, and I would agree with them. To make Shyvana a diver who's actually good at the job would require more substantial changes to her kit.

Riot fucks up quite a lot. I argue against them when I believe they have fucked up. I have been correct on several occasions, incorrect on several too.Don't just take what Riot says at face value 100% of the time. They have been wrong before and will be wrong again.

> [{quoted}](name=LankPants,realm=OCE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Bj78lEp4,comment-id=00020001000200000000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2016-10-19T03:45:26.150+0000)
>
> Low damage isn't part of the Vanguard class. This is a class that contains Amumu, Sejuani and Zac, there's plenty of high damage Vanguards.

Sejuani and Zac are not high damage, and Amumu only deals damage if he builds AP, in which case he typically plays more like a mage.

> Current Ekko's best fit is either Diver or Vanguard, probably Diver. He's getting changed in the preseason though and Riot's explicitly stated that the want to align him more with Skirmishers.

I've seen no such explicit mention. Outside of that list, they usually state the goal with him is to be an assassin with less damage but more utility than average, aka the assassin version of Ashe.

> Where else do you put them? I'd make an argument that Ahri could be a Skirmisher and Liss could be a Disrupter but neither of these placements are really better than Burst Mage for either.

I wouldn't put them anywhere, I'm using them as an example of how having an ability outside of the class's typical repertoire doesn't mean they're suddenly a different class.

> All of Shyvana's skills align with Divers. There are divers with durability steroids. There are divers with on-hit AA resets. There are divers with MS steroids and AOE damage spells. Her E is the most generic thing ever. There are Divers with long ranged dashes, although few as long as Shyvana. Why wouldn't you put Shyvana in the Diver class, she doesn't seem to break any rules and seems to fit very well overall.

The signature of a class is not what their skills do, it's what their kit does when working in unison. It's not that Shyvana's kit breaks the rules of being a diver, it's that it can't get the job done. Again, a diver dives into the back line, sticks to a target, and locks them down in order to kill them quickly. Shyvana can neither lock down a target nor stick to it because she lacks CC and is too easily kited. By contrast Nocturne is going to jump in there, wreck the enemy's vision and pop spell shield so they can't peel him easily, and fear the target while tearing him apart. Vi is going to ult them, knock them up, burst them with her W and E passive procs, and Q them if they're either going to get away or need another brief moment of interruption. Jarvan is gonna pass through them and knock them up, then trap them in his ult. Diana's gonna dash on top of them and drag all the enemies in and slow them for her team to ideally wombo combo them. Hecarim's gonna ult in to fear them and scatter the enemy team apart to make him harder to peel while knocking the target around with his E. Etc.

By contrast, Shyvana's gonna dive in there, and her target's going to just walk away from her because she has no way to hold them still. If she tries to W to follow, she's probably going to get slowed or CC'd and lose the duration on her MS boost, and then she's gonna just casually walk forward being kited to death. Alternatively, she's going to just turn around and start punching whoever she's actually able to reach while trying to work her way through them the hard way to eventually reach the carries, which is the primary combat pattern for juggernauts.

> Riot fucks up quite a lot. I argue against them when I believe they have fucked up. I have been correct on several occasions, incorrect on several too.Don't just take what Riot says at face value 100% of the time. They have been wrong before and will be wrong again.

I'm not taking everything they say at face value. I didn't say 'they're obviously correct', I said 'I agree with their decision'. It has nothing to do with Shyvana sharing a few basic attributes with divers and everything to do with her lacking the fundamental tools a diver requires to do its job decently. To be an effective diver, she would either require some form of hard CC, or some sort of 'I can not be kited' button.

>Divers are the more mobile portion of the Fighter class. Divers excel at singling out high-priority targets to blitz toward, immediately forcing those targets (and their teammates) to deal with the diver’s presence. Divers are not as durable as the tanks or juggernauts of the world, but Divers can take their fair share of punishment while bringing enough damage to be a real kill threat if left unchecked.

This is Riot's definition of a diver. Nowhere does it mention CC or lockdown of any kind. It simply states that they

* Have an ability to close on a single target ✓
* Immediately force a reaction ✓
* Can single out high priory targets ✓
* Bring enough damage to be a kill threat ✓
* Are not as tanky as a true tank -

That last one is questionable, but it's also defendable when you look at other divers. Arguably J4, Renekton and Hecarim are all about as tanky as Shyvana and they are all divers. Let's contrast that to the juggernaut class.

>Juggernauts are melee titans who relentlessly march down the opposition and devastate those foolish enough to get within their grasp. They are the only subclass who excel at both dealing and taking significant amounts of damage, but in turn they have a tough time closing in on targets due to their low range and extremely limited mobility.

* March down targets -
* Excel at taking and dealing damage ✓
* Tough time closing due to limited mobility X
* Low Range ✓

Shyvana flat out breaks one of the tenets of being a Juggernaut. Admittedly some of parts of these definitions are bullshit, for example 'They are the only subclass who excel at both dealing and taking significant amounts of damage' seems to ignore that the diver subclass exists and does excel at both of these things, just to a lesser degree than juggernauts.

>Sejuani and Zac are not high damage, and Amumu only deals damage if he builds AP, in which case he typically plays more like a mage.

Have you read what Sej's and Zac's Ws do, ever? These are some really high damage abilities, I play Sej and just the DoT on her W can get up towards 1k damage lategame. It is a high damage ability, it's actually one of the highest damage abilities on any tank or bruiser in the game, hell it out damages Shyvana's W most of the time.

As for Skarner outdamageing Zac, Amumu and Sej the stats just don't agree with that. [Skarner has one of the lowest damages per game out of any jungler.](http://champion.gg/statistics/#?sortBy=general.totalDamageDealtToChampions&order=descend&roleSort=Jungle)

>The signature of a class is not what their skills do, it's what their kit does when working in unison. It's not that Shyvana's kit breaks the rules of being a diver, it's that it can't get the job done. Again, a diver dives into the back line, sticks to a target, and locks them down in order to kill them quickly. Shyvana can neither lock down a target nor stick to it because she lacks CC and is too easily kited. By contrast Nocturne is going to jump in there, wreck the enemy's vision and pop spell shield so they can't peel him easily, and fear the target while tearing him apart. Vi is going to ult them, knock them up, burst them with her W and E passive procs, and Q them if they're either going to get away or need another brief moment of interruption. Jarvan is gonna pass through them and knock them up, then trap them in his ult. Diana's gonna dash on top of them and drag all the enemies in and slow them for her team to ideally wombo combo them. Hecarim's gonna ult in to fear them and scatter the enemy team apart to make him harder to peel while knocking the target around with his E. Etc.

If Shyv's ult wasn't uninterruptible do you think she'd be that easy to peel. You can knock back Vi, J4 and Nocturne after their ults end, it's not always enough. Shyvana's problem is that you can knock her out of ult. If she was guarenteed an ult she'd also get around 4 AAs off because you can reset AAs really quick as Shyv and that makes your W last a long arse time. 

I'm really hoping that this is the direction they go in as well, because it's just a logical one to follow. As I said, fix the ult, make it uninterruptible and let Shyv stun against walls for a short duration. That would fix the majority of her issues and make her a strong diver while leaving the few Juggernaut traits she has in tact.

> [{quoted}](name=LankPants,realm=OCE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Bj78lEp4,comment-id=0002000100020000000000000000000000000000000000010000,timestamp=2016-10-19T05:39:57.999+0000)
>
> This is Riot's definition of a diver. Nowhere does it mention CC or lockdown of any kind. It simply states that they
> 
> * Have an ability to close on a single target ✓
> * Immediately force a reaction ✓
> * Can single out high priory targets **X**
> * Bring enough damage to be a kill threat ✓
> * Are not as tanky as a true tank -
> 
> That last one is questionable, but it's also defendable when you look at other divers. Arguably J4, Renekton and Hecarim are all about as tanky as Shyvana and they are all divers. Let's contrast that to the juggernaut class.

Fixed a little mistake for you. Shyvana has no ability to single out a high priority target. Singling someone out would imply the ability to either scatter the enemy team away from a target, or CC them to prevent them from regrouping with their team. I.e.
